column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=Description of the Related Art
#Text=[0005] Subcutaneous injection is a standard method for the delivery of medication into a patient's body.
#Text=To facilitate frequent or continuous subcutaneous injection of medication, subcutaneous injection ports are often used.
#Text=Such injection ports extend through the skin and may remain in place for several days.
#Text=Currently, a major application of such injection ports is to provide continuous delivery of medication, such as insulin, from portable pumps carried with the patient.
#Text=When used with a portable pump, the injection port is typically connected to the pump via a fluid line.
#Text=Another application of subcutaneous injection ports is to permit multiple injections of medication into a patient without the need to re-puncture the patient's skin.

#Text=In this application, medication is injected from a standard medical implement, such as a syringe, through a soft elastomer septum into the injection port which delivers the medication subcutaneously.
#Text=[0006] Subcutaneous injection ports generally require a sharp, rigid needle to pierce the patient's skin when initially attached to the patient.
#Text=However, in some applications, if the needle were left in place through the skin to provide medication delivery, after one or two days the needle could become uncomfortable to the patient.
#Text=To solve this problem, infusion sets with removable needles and soft plastic cannula to be placed inside the body of a patient have been developed.
#Text=However, these sets have many disadvantages.
#Text=There remains a need for an improved infusion set that is less bulky, less susceptible to contamination, more comfortable to a user, and easier to use.
#Text=[0007] Some embodiments of the present invention provide an infusion set comprising a base member, an introducer cap, and an infusion cap.
#Text=The base member preferably comprises a port on a first side thereof, and a soft cannula extending from a second side of the base member.
#Text=The port is configured to be in fluid communication with the cannula.
#Text=The port also comprises a septum adapted to seal the port against unwanted fluid flow.
#Text=The introducer cap is adapted to be mounted to the base member and has a needle adapted to extend through the septum and said soft cannula in an assembled position.
#Text=Other embodiments can use a rigid cannula of various materials.
#Text=The infusion cap comprises a lumen adapted to receive an elongate flexible tube.
#Text=The infusion cap also comprises a hard cannula adapted to be inserted through the septum and to place said soft cannula in fluid communication with said lumen.
#Text=[0008] The base member is preferably circular, and the port preferably comprises a cylindrical portion extending from a first side of the base member.
#Text=The introducer cap preferably comprises a hollow cylindrical portion extending from the second side of the introducer cap and located coaxially with the introducer needle.
#Text=The infusion cap preferably comprises a hollow cylindrical portion extending from the second side of the infusion cap and located coaxially with the hard cannula.

#Text=The first side of the infusion cap preferably is dome-shaped, and the infusion cap is preferably adapted to be rotatable relative to the base member when the infusion cap and the base member are assembled.
